item.title: Hoppin' Giovanni (Rapini with white beans)
item.description: This simple dish of beans and greens comes from Mary Ann Esposito's Ciao Italia. It's similar in many ways to the traditional "Hoppin' John" served for good luck for the new year. Hoppin' Giovanni Wash and chop a bunch of rapini (broccoli rabe). If you can't find rapini, some other mild green like turnip greens (or even kale) would work nicely. Mince a shallot fine and saute in a large pan in olive oil until fragrant.
